TrainingDetails.Title: News Article
TrainingDetails.Abstract: The News Article publishes a news story. These articles are then pulled into the BYU-I Newsroom, News Index, and News Archive pages. Specific articles can be highlighted on home pages as well.
TrainingDetails.BodyCopy:
Required Information:

  • You need to know how to upload photos into the Ingeniux CMS

 

Required Elements on this page(These elements are needed to save the page): 

  • Title
  • Abstract
  • Date
  • Image
  • ImageThumbnail
  • Author

 

 

Title Element:

Here you need to enter the title of the article that is to be pasted in the body copy of the web page.

Abstract Element:

A summary of the article

Date Element: 

The date the article was published. It should be in the MM/DD/YYYY format. If it is not in that format, it will not save correctly.

Image Element:

You need to upload an image prior to this step. 

You will be replacing the image that was placed in as a default.

Maximum image size is: 

Width: 100px

Height: 80px

  1. Click on browse on the right of the box.
  2. Find your image within the structure
  3. Click ok
  4. Add alt text in the box provided. This text should be descriptive of the image you are adding to the page.


ImageThumbnail Element:  

You need to upload an image prior to this step. 

You will be replacing the image that was placed in as a default.

Maximum image size is: 

Width: 80px

Height: 80px

  1. Click on browse on the right of the box.
  2. Find your image within the structure
  3. Click ok
  4. Add alt text in the box provided. This text should be descriptive of the image you are adding to the page.

 

Author Element:

This is where you put the article's author.

Body Copy Element:

This is where your article will go.

When you are done with this go to the top of the page, left side and click save. If the above elements are filled in correctly, then no errors will appear. However, if you missed filling in one of the elements above you will have to go back and fill it in before you can continue to save.

 

The next few elements are so the page displays correctly and so that the news article is published in the correct news index.

You will need to know which index your article is to be publish in to complete the next steps.

 

Publications

This is the location where the article you just created will be published. Please choose the correct indexes.

For example if you work for University Communications you would choose "News and Notes" from the slection

Related Links

The organization you work for should also have its won related links section. You will need to choose that one.

News

Choose the "News Navigation Component." 

Site Control

You will need to choose the site control that is related to your department.
